title: University Library
description: A modern university library management system built with Next.js, featuring user authentication, book cataloging, borrowing workflows, and admin dashboard for managing users and book requests.
longDescription:
This is a comprehensive University Library Management System that provides a complete digital solution for managing library operations in an educational institution. The application is built using modern web technologies and follows best practices for scalability, security, and user experience.
Key Features:
For Students/Users:
Secure authentication system with role-based access control
Browse and search through an extensive book catalog
Request book borrowing with approval workflow
View personal borrowing history and current loans
Profile management with account status tracking
Responsive design for mobile and desktop access
For Administrators:
Comprehensive admin dashboard with analytics
User management system for approving new accounts
Book catalog management (add, edit, delete books)
Borrowing request approval workflow
User status management (pending, approved, rejected)
Advanced book search and filtering capabilities
Technical Architecture:
The system is built on a modern tech stack including Next.js 15 with App Router, React 19, and TypeScript for type safety. It uses Neon Database (PostgreSQL) with Drizzle ORM for robust data management, NextAuth.js for secure authentication, and Tailwind CSS for a beautiful, responsive UI.
Infrastructure highlights:
Serverless PostgreSQL database for scalability
Redis caching for improved performance
Rate limiting for API protection
ImageKit integration for book cover management
Background job processing for workflow automation
Security & Performance:
JWT-based authentication with bcrypt password hashing
Role-based access control (Admin/User)
API rate limiting to prevent abuse
Optimized image delivery and caching
Type-safe database operations with Drizzle ORM
The application demonstrates modern web development practices with a focus on user experience, security, and maintainability, making it suitable for educational institutions looking to digitize their library operations.
challenges: Building a scalable university library system that handles complex user workflows, secure authentication, and real-time book management while maintaining performance and user experience.
solutions: Implemented a modern full-stack architecture using Next.js 15 with App Router, Neon PostgreSQL database with Drizzle ORM for type-safe operations, NextAuth.js for secure role-based authentication, and Tailwind CSS for responsive design. Added Redis caching, rate limiting, and ImageKit for optimized performance.
results: A robust library management platform with seamless user/admin workflows, secure authentication system, real-time book cataloging, efficient borrowing approval process, and responsive UI that scales from mobile to desktop, providing a complete digital solution for university library operations.

title: E Tutor
description: E-Tutor is a modern online learning platform built with Vue.js that connects students with expert instructors. It features a comprehensive course catalog with advanced filtering, user authentication, and an intuitive interface for discovering and enrolling in courses across various subjects and skill levels
longDescription:
E-Tutor is a comprehensive online learning platform designed to revolutionize the way people access education. Built with cutting-edge web technologies including Vue.js 3, Vite, and modern CSS with Sass, this platform provides a seamless learning experience for both students and instructors.
Key Features:
For Students:
Advanced Course Discovery: Browse thousands of courses with sophisticated filtering options including category, tools, ratings, course level, price range, and duration
Smart Search: Intelligent search functionality with real-time suggestions and course recommendations
Course Previews: Detailed course information with instructor profiles, ratings, student counts, and pricing
Responsive Design: Optimized for all devices from mobile phones to desktop computers
User Authentication: Secure sign-up and sign-in system for personalized learning experiences
For Instructors:
Course Management: Easy-to-use interface for creating and managing course listings
Student Analytics: Track course performance and student engagement
Professional Profiles: Showcase expertise and build credibility with detailed instructor profiles
Technical Excellence:
Modern Architecture: Built with Vue.js 3 Composition API for optimal performance and maintainability
Scalable Design: Component-based architecture ensuring code reusability and easy maintenance
Advanced Styling: Custom Sass framework with responsive design patterns and consistent theming
Performance Optimized: Fast loading times with Vite build system and efficient asset management
Cross-Platform: Works seamlessly across all modern browsers and devices
Learning Categories:
The platform covers diverse subjects including Development, Business, Finance & Accounting, IT & Software, Design, Marketing, Personal Development, and many more. Each category features subcategories with detailed course counts and filtering options.
Quality Assurance:
Rating System: 5-star rating system with detailed reviews
Course Levels: From beginner to expert, ensuring appropriate content for all skill levels
Price Flexibility: Both free and paid courses with transparent pricing
Duration Options: Courses ranging from 1-7 days to 6-12 months to fit any learning schedule
E-Tutor represents the future of online education, combining powerful technology with user-centric design to create an engaging and effective learning environment for everyone.
challenges: The project faced significant technical hurdles including legacy Sass deprecation warnings from outdated @import syntax that were causing build issues. The complex filter functionality required a modular component architecture that wasn't initially in place. Additionally, specific UI/UX design requirements for the filter sidebar and course listing needed careful implementation. Ensuring responsive design consistency across all devices and managing filter states between components presented further complexity
solutions: We modernized the entire Sass architecture by migrating from deprecated @import to modern @use syntax and replaced the deprecated darken() function with color.adjust(). The filter functionality was completely refactored into a dedicated FilterSidebar component for better modularity. We implemented collapsible filter sections with proper styling and interactive elements. A custom responsive framework was built using mixins and breakpoint systems. The component communication was handled through Vue's event-driven architecture using $emit for clean parent-child interactions.
results: The transformation resulted in a completely clean build system with all Sass deprecation warnings eliminated and significantly improved build performance. The codebase became highly modular with reusable components and clean separation of concerns. The user experience was dramatically enhanced with an intuitive filter interface featuring expandable sections and real-time updates. The platform now works seamlessly across all devices with fully responsive design. The final codebase is highly maintainable with clear component hierarchy and comprehensive documentation, providing a solid foundation for future development and scalability.

This e-commerce platform represents a modern approach to online retail, combining powerful functionality with elegant design to create an engaging shopping experience for users while maintaining high performance and accessibility standards.
challenges: The project faced critical build failures due to React 19 compatibility issues with react-helmet-async and CSS compilation errors caused by invalid syntax in SCSS files. The CSS minimizer was encountering "Unexpected '/'" errors from problematic comment syntax, while Swiper integration was failing due to CSS modules generating invalid selectors with special characters like
solutions: To resolve the dependency conflicts, we implemented --legacy-peer-deps flag during npm installation to bypass peer dependency restrictions. For the CSS compilation issues, we systematically converted all problematic // comments to proper /* */ CSS comments across multiple SCSS files and replaced CSS custom properties with hardcoded values in the main stylesheet. The Swiper integration was fixed by updating the configuration to use standard class names with :global() wrapper in SCSS, eliminating the invalid selector generation.
results: The project now builds successfully with all features fully functional, including responsive design, theme switching, and interactive carousels. The build process completes without errors, producing optimized CSS and JavaScript bundles. The codebase is now maintainable with proper syntax standards, ensuring long-term stability and easier future development while maintaining the modern e-commerce functionality and sleek user interface design.
